column5: Well had a great time in lower Buckhorn as always stayed at SUNRISE RESORT Your Hosts: Cees & Anya Slothouber are great people to deal with.    Friday was just beautiful had a great time walking around town checking out the shops and doing a little bit of gear shopping behind the wifes back. No fishing friday had to wait till 12am May 17th since thats when fishing opens in lower Buckhorn. Well i started fishing from 12am till 3am and man was the bite on with in 40min of haveing the line wet i had already landed 28 big fat crappie. At this point i forgot the camara was having way to much fun. Well around 2:40am i was about to call it quits when out of no wear i felt a hard hit. I knew it had to bigger then a crappie and low and behold i pulled out a 24" Walleye. All this time i had been fishing just from the dock and it had been a great nite. I was useing a C8025MGX Pflueger Supreme Spinning reel along with the power pro 5 pound braided line and Shakespeare Ugly Stick Lite Graphite rod nice little set-up for under $175.  Well when i did remember the camara it was just about to clean my catch from my 6am fishing trip the fallowing day.
Great Report! Which lake did u fish on? I go up on Chemonge Lake in the summer
Lower Buckhorn lake next to lock 31 didn't realy fish the rest of the lake all the big Walleye where in that spot.
Thanks for the report. No wonder I never catch crappie in Buckhorn. They bite at night! It could also be those musky lures I use.
Absolutely beautiful shots AG.. thanks so much for sharing those..
You certainly have a keen eye for photography.....beautiful scenery shots!!!  Jason
Sounds like yous had a great weekend nice pictures you took  Rob
